bibl.title: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, August 17, 1871

div1.p: William Lazear writes about a heat wave, travel plans, and family news.

div1.head: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, August 17, 1871
div1.opener:
LAZEAR BROTHERS,
WHOLESALE GROCERS,
77 EXCHANGE PLACE.
BALTIMORE, Aug 17 1871 5 30 pm
My Dear Wife
div1.p:
I am disappointed
to get no letter from you this
morning -- though trust
that the evening mail will
bring me one

Yesterday and last night
were the hottest twenty four hours
I ever experienced- The
Thermometer on our porch
indicated 84° at ten oclock
last night -- And in
our office it was 94 to 96
during the entire afternoon
-- Today, however, brings us
a delightful change, a
pleasant breeze has been stirring
with prospect of rain

Jim writes that he is
enjoying himself very much
on Cape May -- they expect
to come home tomorrow
-- My arrangements are
still, to go out to Jordan
Springs, Saturday afternoon
-- and if you are equal
to leaving on the early train
to come home Monday morning
Jesse has expressed a
willingness and Willie a
determination to accompany
me -- The former
has the cold again, but
otherwise both boys are
very well -- and look
just as sweet as they
can be

I have only been able to
write you hastily past
several days but as said
you were willing to recovery
anything -- I wont apologize
-- The Turnbulls expect to
to go to house keeping this fall
-- Harry calls to report his
proggress in house hunting
-- and to post me for our
convenience -- If we
conclude to resume house
keeping this winter it would
be pleasant to be near them
